entry.title: New release for Postiz: S3 default integrity change - effecting cloudflare
entry.content:
In AWS SDK for JavaScript v3.729.0, they released changes to the S3 client that adopts new default integrity protections.

This automatically crashes every R2 upload. See more here: https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-js-v3/issues/6810

AWS's response is awful; they don't care. We have followed up with some of the fixes and implemented them in the repo. Please make sure you upgrade to the latest docker or you might not be able to use Postiz.

entry.title: New release for Postiz: Register only once (Disable Signup)!
entry.content:
You all have been asking for it, so here it is. When you pass the variable DISABLE_REGISTRATION=true it will let you register only once and then disable the signup. In case you want to re-register, you will need to remove your User / Organization record from the DB.

What's Changed

  • Register once by @nevo-david in https://github.com/gitroomhq/postiz-app/pull/569 Full Changelog: https://github.com/gitroomhq/postiz-app/compare/v1.28.1...v1.29.1

entry.title: New release for Postiz: Using Postiz on a non-secured server
entry.content:
Postiz could not work only on secured servers, only https / localhost. This is because we used secured cookies are available only to the server.

That resulted in many support questions and people who can't run Postiz. Now you can pass a new env variable called NOT_SECURED=true. This will allow you to run Postiz on a nonsecured server. We recommend everybody work on a secured server, but we can understand if you can't.
